benchmark_details.name: Human-Driver Behavior and Decision-Making (HBD) Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The HBD dataset integrates human driver behavior logic with detailed environmental perception, specifically designed for training the DME-Driver autonomous driving system.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the HBD dataset is to enhance the robustness of an autonomous driving system by understanding and mimicking human-like driving behaviors.

data.source: Integrated from multiple datasets including Look-Both-Ways, BDD-X, and Nuscenes, with additional new data collected from the Virtual HBD sub-dataset.
data.annotation: Combines GPT-4V pre-annotation followed by manual corrections with structured dialogue generation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are derived from evaluations comparing the HBD dataset outputs with human driving logic.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates closer alignment with human decision-making processes.
methodology.validation: Empirical evaluations conducted to assess the accuracy of the Decision-Maker against human behavior.

targeted_risks.harm: Understanding and detecting biases in driving logic and potential safety implications.
